Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming.
I could tell that the people working behind the scenes really cared about their film. Terribly acted and humorous performance from Jonathan Breck and Luis Enrique Castello (enjoyable kidnapper).
The effects were well-done; agree with others that there was one bad night vision shot. Did not care for the soundtrack though

Well,I am a dancer so automatically I liked this film. If you are a fan of Zorro, Indiana Jones, or action in general this is a must-see. Directed by Republic's ace team of William C. A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The cat, left to fend for itself when its owner moves away, has gone feral. If you've seen "Cat People," this movie is basically what happens if the girl had changed in between films - acted like herself but also kept some of the animal characteristics.
